intro: Echidnopsis globosa, commonly known as the globular lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globe-shaped rosette of fleshy, dark green leaves. The plant produces tall, slender stems with showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated by gardeners interested in exotic plants.
